SEARCH
Package client.keyMaps

Class KeyInputHandler

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.KeyAdapter
client.keyMaps.KeyInputHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener
public class KeyInputHandler extends KeyAdapter
Handles keyboard input for the application.

This class intercepts KeyEvents and maps them to game actions (InputAction) based on configurable key bindings. It supports two players and specific control schemes like NES or Modern Tetris styles.

  • Method Details

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      Invoked when a key has been pressed. Checks if the key corresponds to a bound action and triggers it.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Overrides:
      keyPressed in class KeyAdapter
      Parameters:
      e - The key event.

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
      Invoked when a key has been released. Used for actions that depend on holding a key (e.g., movement or soft drop).
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface KeyListener
      Overrides:
      keyReleased in class KeyAdapter
      Parameters:
      e - The key event.

    • getKeyForAction

      public int getKeyForAction(InputAction action, boolean player1)
      Helper method to find the key code currently bound to a specific action. Needed for the Settings UI to display current bindings.
      Parameters:
      action - The action to look up.
      player1 - true to check Player 1's bindings, false for Player 2.
      Returns:
      The key code bound to the action, or -1 if not bound.

    • getGoBackToMenuKey

      public int getGoBackToMenuKey()
      Gets the key code currently bound to the "Go Back to Menu" action.
      Returns:
      The key code.

    • isKeyBound

      public boolean isKeyBound(int key)
      Checks if a specific key code is currently bound to any action.
      Parameters:
      key - The key code to check.
      Returns:
      true if the key is bound, false otherwise.

    • bindKeyToPlayerAction

      public void bindKeyToPlayerAction(int key, InputAction action, boolean player1)
      Binds a specific key to a player action.
      Parameters:
      key - The key code to bind.
      action - The action to trigger.
      player1 - true for Player 1, false for Player 2.

      Parameters:
      key - The key code to unbind.

    • unbindPlayerAction

      public void unbindPlayerAction(InputAction action, boolean player1)
      Unbinds a specific action for a player, effectively removing the key associated with it.
      Parameters:
      action - The action to unbind.
      player1 - true for Player 1, false for Player 2.

    • unbindGoBackToMenuAction

      public void unbindGoBackToMenuAction()
      Unbinds the "Go Back to Menu" action.

    • changeKeyBinding

      public void changeKeyBinding(InputAction action, int newKeyCode, boolean player1)
      Removes the old binding for an action and sets a new one. If the new key was used elsewhere, it is unbound from that previous action.
      Parameters:
      action - The action to rebind.
      newKeyCode - The new key code to assign.
      player1 - true for Player 1, false for Player 2.

    • setPlayer1Board

      public void setPlayer1Board(BoardWithPhysics player1Board)
